result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

1:57 PM Defendant Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Spanish Interpreter Brenda Bartholomew is sworn-in. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense just received discovery, included DVD that was received this morning. Case was previously assigned to ADA Osbourne, and is awaiting re-assignment to get offer. 
State does not have an offer ready to share. 
Court will set FP date.
Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

11:01 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon. Dawn Maldonado appeared in person as interpreter and previously sworn. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT COURT DATE.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Atty Pablo Galaviz
Atty Pablo Galaviz
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:38 AM Defendant Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter and previously sworn. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation. An attorney will be appointed. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $5000.00

10:12 AM Defendant Grimaldi R Figueroa Colon not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter and previously sworn. State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
EXT CODE 3
